title: Momentum - direction of momentum and velocity

content.question: A semicircular path connects three points labeled <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">X</mi></math>, <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi mathvariant="normal">Y</mi></math>, and <math alttext="Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Z</mtext></math>, as shown in the figure. A particle is initially at point <math alttext="X" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>X</mtext></math> and moves along the path with a constant speed toward point <math alttext="Z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Z</mtext></math>. When the particle is at point <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mtext>Y</mtext></math>, as shown in the figure, which of the following diagrams correctly represents the directions of the velocity <math alttext="vector v" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mover><mi>v</mi><mo>→</mo></mover></math> and momentum <math alttext="vector p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mover><mi>p</mi><mo>→</mo></mover></math> of the object?

choices.label: The figure shows three points, labeled X, Y, and Z, and two vectors, labeled p and v, on a semicircle that opens downward.
